Michelle King , who produces the show with his wife Michelle King , said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Michelle King said. But Keith Urbahn, who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out. "This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Urbahn said

winner Felipe Esparza - are near the end of their 60-city comedy tour and coming to the American Bank Center Selena Auditorium. "Texas jokes are great, until you're in Idaho," Roy Wood said. You do border crossing, bilingual classrooms, they're not going to get that in Montana or Vermont. Lots of material is restricted to geography. "What's best about it for me is how many people who are coming out who never saw the show. It's good for comedy because it's bringing people who have never been to comedy shows to my performance. It helps my own career down the road, as well as the tour. From the moment he debuted on "Late Night with David Letterman " and opened with jokes about suicide, al-Qaida and race relations between Latinos and blacks, Roy Wood has shown that there are few subjects off limits

NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. Finally getting an opportunity and making the most of it, and this was another opportunity last night, they don't come around that often, i just wanted to make the most of it, we did as a team, a great team win, a great group of guys in the locker room, just really excited to be a part of it, said Aaron Rodgers . And Aaron Rodgers is getting even more MVP treatment tonight, where you can catch him on The Late Show with David Letterman . The show starts at 10:35 p.m. tonight, right after Channel

's decision to appoint two longtime "foes" of Social Security, Alan Simpson and Erskine Bowles , to co-chair his deficit commission, which proposed trimming the program's payouts by increasing the retirement age. Barack Obama could have said that's not on the table, Sen. Bernie Sanders said. "He didn't say that."
